title: Over six lakh Maharashtra farmers yet to get 2017 loan waiver scheme benefit: Minister in assembly
content: Under the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Shetkari Sanman Yojana, 44.04 lakh farmers, out of the total 50.60 lakh eligible ones, have so far received benefits of the loan waiver scheme, while the process for the remaining 6.56 lakh farmers is underway

title: Watch: PM Modi in Israel: a missed opportunity on Palestine: The Hindu Editorial
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s 24-hour visit to Jerusalem was a significant bilateral outreach to Israel, but a missed opportunity on Palestine, with complex consequences for India’s ties with West Asia.

title: Watch: Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia cleared of charges in Delhi liquor policy case
content: A Delhi court discharged all 23 accused in the 2021–22 excise policy case, including Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia and K Kavitha, ruling there was “no overarching conspiracy or criminal intent”. The judge said the CBI’s case was based on conjecture.

title: Like many before him, Panneerselvam joins DMK, but here’s why he is different
content: None of those who went back to the DMK or began their new innings in the ruling party were seriously considered for the post of Chief Minister when they were in the AIADMK. But Mr. Panneerselvam was handpicked by Jayalalithaa in 2001 and 2014 to head the government

content: Avimukteshwaranand said even if any wrongdoing had occurred, it would not automatically establish who was responsible. “The child who never came to us cannot be easily linked to our name,” he said.

title: 8 cheetahs from Africa to arrive at M.P.'s Kuno National Park on Saturday

title: Inter-caste row: Bridegroom stoned to death by bride’s family members, hours after wedding

title: Thotlakonda Buddhist Complex to open new interpretation centre in Visakhapatnam

title: Watch: From take-off to turbulence: What is going wrong with UDAN scheme?
content: Launched in 2016, the UDAN scheme aimed to make air travel affordable and connect smaller towns across India. We break down what the scheme promised, what the numbers reveal, and the larger questions around its long-term sustainability.

title: In Andhra city, a morning staple turns deadly
content: Five persons died and fifteen others, including three infants, are on ventilator support with acute renal failure after consuming what is believed to be adulterated milk supplied by a vendor to 106 families between February 16 and 18 in Rajamahendravaram city. T. Appalanaidu finds out what exactly happened

title: Under POCSO, consent on trial
content: For over a decade, the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012, has served as India’s dedicated law against child sexual abuse. As families invoke it to oppose under-18 consensual inter-caste and inter-faith relationships, Aaratrika Bhaumik finds that courts are now confronting the law’s unintended consequences

title: Activists urge Karnataka government to ensure proper implementation of CITIIS 2.0 project in Belagavi

title: Deadlines, disputes, doubts dog UMEED for waqf properties

content: The Karnataka Policy and Planning Commission and the Karnataka Administrative Reforms Commission have against ‘automatic’ replacement of retiring staff

Subbarayudu Tirupati Airport Director Bhuminathan and others inspected the site being readied for the ‘Bhumi Puja’.

content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) called the community “vibrant” and said, “Their enduring bond with India, traditions carried across generations and remarkable contributions to Israel serve as a living bridge between our countries.”

title: Railway Minister announces portal to attract innovative tech solutions
content: The policy proposes a dedicated innovation portal to enable open submissions of detailed proposals, and provides financial support of up to 50% of the development cost for selected solutions

title: From the ashes, emerges a green idea at Brahmapuram
content: The first Compressed Biogas plant in the State, which converts biodegradable waste into biogas, has become operational at the Brahmapuram garbage treatment yard of the Kochi Corporation. M.P. Praveen meets the engineers and managers of the plant set up by the BPCL Kochi Refinery at the plant site to learn about the facility, which is expected to solve the issue of waste management in the city

title: Stand-off between Delhi and H.P. police forces triggers political row in hill State
content: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu termed Delhi Police’s action ‘an attempt to undermine the sovereignty of the State’

title: Knueppel sets rookie 3-pt. record -- in 59 games
content: Kon Knueppel broke Keegan Murray's NBA rookie record for 3-pointers, making his 207th on Thursday night against the Pacers.

title: OSU's Styles wows with 43.5-inch combine vertical
content: Projected top-10 pick Sonny Styles posted the best vertical jump by an off-ball linebacker at the combine since 2003 and also dazzled with a 4.46 time in the 40-yard dash and an 11-foot-2-inch broad jump Thursday.

title: Sources: Trump, college leaders to meet March 6
content: Conference commissioners are expected to join sports celebrities and dignitaries on March 6 in a roundtable discussion with President Donald Trump about the future of college athletics, sources said.

title: Hawks plan Magic City night to honor 'institution'
content: The Hawks are paying tribute to Magic City, Atlanta's famed strip club, with a promotional night planned for March 16.

title: Purdue's Smith joins elite list with 1,000th assist
content: Purdue point guard Braden Smith became the fifth player in Division I history to reach 1,000 assists with his sixth assist against No. 13 Michigan State on Thursday night.

title: Neymar shushes critics after first goals in return
content: Neymar broke his 2026 goal drought in spectacular fashion Thursday, leading Santos to a 2-1 victory over Vasco da Gama in the fourth round of the Brasileirão.

title: NCAA panel proposes targeting ejection changes
content: A Division I football panel is proposing a series of rules changes involving targeting ejections, player dress codes and fair catches, the NCAA announced Thursday.

title: Source: Fins 1st, Steelers worst in NFLPA survey
content: For the third consecutive year, the Dolphins ranked first in the NFL Players Association annual report cards, according to survey results obtained by ESPN. The Steelers finished last.

content: Panarin wanted to wear the No. 72 upon being traded to Los Angeles. The only problem is the Kings' mascot already wore that number.

content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

content: The playoff races have restarted, with many teams seeking to bolster their rosters for a deep run this spring.

content: Through his foundation, the Maple Leafs center has driven awareness of the mental health conversation.

content: Our list of the elite at every position continues with a spot ruled by some of baseball's young stars.

content: We're handing out report cards on big offseason moves, starting with the Jermaine Johnson-T'Vondre Sweat trade.

title: Max Scherzer's re-signing with Blue Jays fulfills wish from daughter's letter to the club
content: On Wednesday, a source confirmed to ESPN's Alden Gonzalez that Scherzer and the Blue Jays had reached an agreement to keep the 41-year-old three-time Cy Young winner in Toronto.

title: Mexico violence: What happened, FIFA's response and what it means for the World Cup
content: Amid cartel-related violence in Mexico, soccer leagues suspended games. Will the situation affect the country's status as a host for the World Cup?

title: Inside the secret history of the black mamba
content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.

title: It's been three years since Premier League issued against Man City. What's going on?
content: The Premier League announced it was charging Man City for breaching the rules in February 2023. City have denied the charges, and the hearings ended in December 2024. What is taking so long?

title: Cleveland Heights to honor Olympic gold medalist Laila Edwards
content: Cleveland Heights plans to honor Edwards, the first Black woman to play for the U.S. women's national team.

title: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao are fighting: Is this 2011?
content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

title: Women's boxing pound-for-pound rankings: A unanimous choice for No. 1
content: Claressa Shields' continued dominance keeps her firmly atop the list. Here's the latest pound-for-pound rankings.

content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Julius Randle, LaMelo Ball and more.

title: Stashing these injured players is a winning move
content: Eric Karabell serves up a list of currently injured players to keep on your radar for the last few rounds of your fantasy drafts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Chelsea, PSG watch Genk trio
content: Scouts from clubs including Chelsea, Manchester City, Man United and Paris Saint-Germain watched three Racing Genk stars play. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: US military shoots down govt drone in Texas, leading to flight disruption
content: In a joint statement, the Pentagon, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and CBP confirmed that the military used a "counter-unmanned aircraft system ... to mitigate a seemingly threatening unmanned aerial system operating within military airspace." The agencies added that the episode "took place far away from populated areas and there were no commercial aircraft in the vicinity.

title: 'May you find strength ... ': Kohli's emotional note after demise of Rinku's father
content: Rinku Singh's father breathed his last on Friday morning at the Yatharth Hospital in Greater Noida, informed the hospital PRO. He was undergoing treatment at Yatharth Hospital in Greater Noida,.

title: Watch: Strong earthquake rattles Kolkata, residents flee homes, offices in panic
content: Strong tremors, estimated at magnitude 5.4, shook Kolkata on Friday afternoon, causing panic and prompting residents to evacuate homes and offices. The earthquake's epicenter was located just 3 km inside Bangladesh, near the India-Bangladesh border, with tremors felt across the city and surrounding areas.

title: After Pichai's AI push, Google managers issue stark warning to all staff on AI skills
content: Google is turning up the heat on AI adoption across the company. Months after CEO Sundar Pichai told employees to use AI for higher productivity, managers have started informing non-technical staff that their AI usage will be factored into performance reviews. Sales employees have been given weekly quotas for AI tool usage, while engineers already have AI baked into their job descriptions.

title: 'Yuvraj is his mentor': Ashwin shushes Amir over 'slogger' remark
content: Ravichandran Ashwin defended Abhishek Sharma after Mohammad Amir called him “just a slogger” following three ducks in the T20 World Cup. Abhishek silenced critics with a quick 55 off 30 balls against Zimbabwe. Ashwin praised his bat swing and rejected the label, while Abhishek said he had waited for this moment and appreciated the team’s support.

title: 'No overarching conspiracy or criminal intent': Why court cleared Kejriwal, Sisodia in excise case
content: A Delhi court discharged Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia, and 21 others in the excise policy case, citing a lack of cogent evidence and no prima facie case. The judge found no overarching conspiracy or criminal intent in the policy's formulation, criticising the CBI's investigative approach and reliance on approver statements.

title: Block lays off 40% staff after CEO Jack Dorsey calls layoffs 'destructive to morale'
content: Block, led by CEO Jack Dorsey, has drastically cut its workforce by nearly half, impacting over 4,000 employees. Dorsey cited a shift towards leaner, AI-driven operations as the reason, preferring a single, decisive layoff to avoid prolonged uncertainty and morale damage. Generous severance packages are being offered to departing staff.

title: Domestic help carries out 'fake ED raid' at retired employer's house
content: A domestic help orchestrated a fake Enforcement Directorate raid on her elderly employer's home in Delhi, enlisting relatives and associates. The plan unraveled when the victim's grandson, an ED lawyer, confronted the imposters by phone, leading to their escape with a portion of the stolen cash. The maid and her sister-in-law have been arrested.

title: Modi, Amit Shah hatched biggest conspiracy of independent India to crush AAP: Kejriwal
content: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal hailed his discharge in the CBI's excise policy case as a "triumph of truth," calling the investigation a politically motivated conspiracy to dismantle the AAP. He asserted his honesty and accused Prime Minister Modi and Home Minister Shah of orchestrating a "fabricated" case to jail top party leaders.

title: IDC forecasts smartphone market to suffer its biggest-decline ever in 2026
content: The global smartphone market faces its sharpest downturn in 2026, with shipments projected to drop 12.9% due to surging memory chip prices. This crisis, driven by AI infrastructure demand, is forcing a structural reset, making sub-$100 phones uneconomical and benefiting premium brands like Apple and Samsung.

title: Stock market down: Nifty50 below 25,200, Sensex crashes over 1,000 points - top reasons
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex crashed in trade on Friday on weak global cues and persistent FII selling. While Nifty50 went below 25,200, BSE Sensex dropped over 1,000 points.

title: A chilling confession, 3 gunshots and tense standoff: UP man kills wife’s lover in Meerut
content: A man shot dead his estranged wife's partner in Meerut after a long-standing domestic dispute over child custody. The accused later appeared in a social media video admitting to the crime and threatening his wife. He was apprehended by police after a standoff in a sugarcane field.

title: Newlyweds Rashmika-Vijay make their first appearance after their wedding — watch
content: Newlyweds Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda made their first public appearance as a married couple after returning from their Udaipur wedding. Rashmika stunned in a vibrant red bridal ensemble, while Vijay complemented her in a silver kurta pyjama. The affectionate pair walked hand-in-hand, sharing warm greetings and flying kisses with the paparazzi, who showered them with congratulations.

title: T20 World Cup: What Team India needs to do to reach semi-finals
content: India's path to the T20 World Cup 2026 semi-finals is now clear, with a win against West Indies at Eden on Sunday securing their spot. Following South Africa's victory, the final Group 1 match is a virtual quarterfinal. India's dominant batting performance against Zimbabwe set them up for this crucial encounter.

title: Howrah gang war explodes: Rivalry ends in point-blank execution
content: Howrah Police arrested three associates of Harun Khan, the main suspect in a gang war shooting that claimed Mohammad Shafiq's life. The trio, apprehended in Kolkata, allegedly aided Khan and his accomplice Rohit Hossain in their escape after the murder. Investigations reveal the killing stemmed from a territorial dispute and extortion rivalry between rival gangs.

title: ‘Cup of patience has overflowed’: Why Pakistan launched strikes on Afghanistan's major cities
content: Pakistan conducted air strikes on major Afghan cities, including Kabul, Kandahar, and Paktia, escalating border tensions. This action follows retaliatory attacks by Taliban forces, with Pakistan declaring an "open war" after cross-border clashes. The confrontation marks a significant escalation since the Taliban's return to power in 2021.

title: Watch: Teary Kejriwal's emotional moment with wife Sunita & kids
content: A Delhi court discharged Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia in the liquor excise policy case, refusing to take cognisance of the CBI chargesheet. The court found no criminal intent or substantiated conspiratorial role, stating allegations failed judicial scrutiny. Both leaders were greeted with emotional celebrations by family and supporters.

title: Ram Charan's business empire: Actor builds ventures in films, sports, aviation
content: Tollywood star Ram Charan, son of Chiranjeevi, has built an impressive empire beyond his 18-year acting career.  He leads big-budget films and runs diverse businesses, including a production house, a polo club, and investments in healthcare and startups. His ventures showcase a sharp business acumen, complementing his successful filmography and earning him a substantial net worth.

title: ‘No words feel enough’: Ex-cricketers stand with Rinku after father’s passing
content: Former cricketers are extending heartfelt condolences to Rinku Singh following the passing of his father, Khanchand Singh. Rinku, who left the T20 World Cup to be with his family, is receiving support from figures like Harbhajan Singh, Yuvraj Singh, and Virender Sehwag. IPL franchises have also shared their sympathies during this difficult period.

title: 5 months, 17 months, and finally freedom: Kejriwal, Sisodia cleared in Delhi excise case
content: Former Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia were acquitted in the Delhi excise policy case. Kejriwal spent five months in jail, while Sisodia was incarcerated for 17 months. The case, investigated by the CBI and ED, alleged irregularities in the 2021-22 liquor policy.

title: Fresh look at India-US trade deal? May be ‘rebalanced’ if circumstances change, says Goyal
content: Piyush Goyal’s comments assume significance after the US Supreme Court ruled that Donald Trump administration's reciprocal tariffs are illegal. Soon after, Trump signed an executive order to impose a 10% global tariff on America’s trading partners.

title: Haryana govt official jumps to death from 6th floor of civil secretariat in Chandigarh
content: A special secretary at the Haryana civil secretariat, Ganesh Das Arora, 58, died by suicide by jumping from his office building. A suicide note found at the scene stated no external pressure, though workplace stress is being investigated. Arora was reportedly distressed over a recent department transfer and was due to retire in October.

title: T20 WC Super 8s standings: India set for virtual QF as SA seal semis spot
content: Defending champions India face a crucial Super 8 clash against the West Indies on Sunday. A victory in Kolkata will secure their semi-final spot in the T20 World Cup. South Africa has already qualified from Group 1. Meanwhile, England have advanced from Group 2, with New Zealand and Pakistan vying for the remaining berth.

title: Watch: President Murmu take sortie in indigenous light combat helicopter 'Prachand'
content: President Droupadi Murmu experienced a flight in the indigenously built Light Combat Helicopter 'Prachand' near the Pakistan border in Jaisalmer. This advanced aircraft, designed for diverse terrains and equipped with modern weaponry, significantly enhances the Indian Air Force's capabilities. The President's sortie underscores India's growing self-reliance in defense technology.

title: 'I am kattar imaandaar': Kejriwal breaks down after clean chit in liquor policy case
content: Former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia have been acquitted of all charges. The Rouse Avenue court delivered the verdict in the case investigated by the CBI. Both leaders had faced allegations and served time in jail. Kejriwal stated that truth always wins. This development marks a significant moment for the Aam Aadmi Party.

title: Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia acquitted in Delhi excise policy case
content: A Delhi court has acquitted former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia in the excise policy case. The CBI had alleged a Rs 100 crore bribe from a "south lobby" to influence the policy. The court's decision marks a significant development in the high-profile political case.

title: Did Pakistan lose another F-16? Afghanistan makes big claim; shares video
content: Afghanistan claims Pakistan's F-16 jet was downed during overnight strikes targeting multiple Afghan cities. Pakistan retaliated for alleged 'unprovoked firing' with Operation Ghazab Lil Haq, reportedly destroying Afghan military bases. This incident echoes past claims of Pakistan's F-16s being targeted during regional tensions, including India's Operation Sindoor.

title: Indore-Pune Air India Express flight’s rough landing causes scare for 160 flyers
content: An Air India Express flight from Indore to Pune experienced a jarring touchdown, prompting the pilot to abort and circle back for a safe landing approximately 25 minutes later. Passengers reported a rough and unsettling experience, with the cabin crew offering no immediate explanation. The airline's spokesperson was contacted for details regarding the incident.

title: Gutkha stains, litter spotted at newly-launched Namo Bharat RRTS stations
content: The newly launched Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat RRTS corridor saw massive footfall on its first full day, exceeding one lakh riders. However, scenes of littering and gutkha stains at stations have raised concerns about commuter responsibility. This highlights the need for stricter enforcement of cleanliness norms to preserve the world-class infrastructure.

title: Rinku Singh’s father passes away after battle with cancer
content: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh's father, Khanchand Singh, has passed away after a battle with advanced liver cancer. He was on ventilator support at a Greater Noida hospital. Rinku, part of the T20 World Cup squad, had briefly returned home earlier due to his father's deteriorating health. His father was a pillar of support for his cricketing dreams.

title: Umar Akmal clears air over post on Babar Azam: 'Not comparing myself with him'
content: Umar Akmal clarified his recent social media post, stating he did not intend to compare himself to Babar Azam or disrespect the Pakistan captain. Akmal explained his intention was to highlight that Azam's batting style is not ideally suited for the T20 middle order, emphasizing role suitability rather than a direct comparison of achievements.

title: Pizzagate and leaked photos: Hillary Clinton faces tough questions over Epstein files
content: Hillary Clinton testified for over six hours before the House Oversight Committee regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, denying any knowledge of their criminal activities. She stated she never encountered Epstein or flew on his plane, and suggested the committee question Donald Trump about his extensive ties to Epstein.

title: 'I lack eyesight, but not vision': Srikanth Bolla’s rise from rejection to success
content: Born visually impaired in rural India, Srikanth Bolla defied societal expectations and institutional barriers to pursue science education. Rejected by Indian institutions, he gained admission to MIT, becoming the first international blind student. Returning to India, he founded Bollant Industries, an eco-friendly packaging company that prioritizes employing people with disabilities, transforming opportunity into dignity.

title: Expelled AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam joins DMK in presence of TN CM Stalin
content: Veteran leader O Panneerselvam, a former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister, has officially joined the DMK. This significant political shift follows his expulsion from the AIADMK and comes after failed attempts to unify the party. Sources suggest the DMK may offer him a seat in the upcoming assembly elections, potentially in his former constituency.

title: 'Open war' declared: Pakistan strikes Kabul, Kandahar — 10 things to know about Operation Ghazab Lil Haq
content: Pakistan conducted airstrikes in Afghanistan targeting Taliban military sites. This action followed alleged unprovoked firing from across the border. The operation, named 'Ghazab Lil Haq', reportedly killed 133 Afghans. Afghanistan condemned the strikes, claiming no casualties. Tensions remain high between the two nations over border disputes and recent military actions.

title: Pune real estate agent plans suicide, smothers wife instead; arrested
content: A 56-year-old Pune real estate agent has been arrested for allegedly smothering his 53-year-old wife. The accused reportedly confessed to the crime, stating financial woes and his wife's depression over childlessness as motives. He also admitted to contemplating suicide before killing his wife and later reporting the incident himself.

title: ‘We want to show fear to the opposition’: Tilak Varma’s bold message after India’s win
content: Tilak Varma's explosive unbeaten 44 off 16 balls, and aggressive contributions from top-order batters powered India to a commanding 72-run victory over Zimbabwe, keeping their semifinal hopes alive.  Adopting a fearless approach, Varma stated the team's intention to instill fear in opponents, emphasizing their commitment to aggressive batting regardless of early wickets.

title: Table No 8 and a 'first date': Israel PM Netanyahu recalls India link behind love story with wife Sara
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu revealed a personal connection to India during a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He shared that one of his first dates with his wife, Sara, took place at an Indian restaurant in Tel Aviv, owned by Reena Pushkarna. “I owe India a great personal debt. When I met Sara (his wife) for the first time, I think our first or second date was in an Indian restaurant in Tel Aviv. It was Reena Pushkarna,” he said.

title: Economy Grew By 7.8% In October-December: New GDP Series Data
content: India's economy grew 7.8 per cent in October-December from the same period a year earlier, after posting 8.4 per cent growth in the previous quarter, the Centre said on Friday.

title: 22% Waste Surge, 60% Dumped Untreated: Kedarnath Choked By Trash
content: In the shadow of the snow-capped Himalayas, where millions seek spiritual solace at one of Hinduism's holiest shrines, a mounting crisis is unfolding: Kedarnath is drowning in its own garbage.

title: Biting, Slapping, And Barricades: The Bitter Fallout Of The JNU "Long March"
content: JNU is seething with rage. Barely a week after a "night of terror", the students were involved in a bitter, some would say 'biting', clash with the Delhi cops.

title: Nitish Katara Murder Convict Vikas Yadav Free To Attend Holi, Surrender Again: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has granted furlough till March 7 to murder convict Vikas Yadav to attend Holi. Yadav, the son of former MP DP Yadav, has served 23 of the 25-year sentence he received for the murder of Nitish Katara in 2002.

title: Will The Fight To Succeed 'El Mencho' Spark New Wave Of Violence In Mexico?
content: The killing of Nemesio Oseguera, also known as "El Mencho," constituted a victory for the government of President Claudia Sheinbaum.

title: Strong Earthquake Tremors Felt In Kolkata, Offices Evacuated
content: People in Kolkata came running out of homes, offices and schools after the tremors of the earthquake, that struck Bangladesh, were felt in the city.

title: US Man Killed By Cuban Cops On Speedboat Wanted To "Liberate" Communist Island
content: Cuba vowed to defend itself against 'terrorist and mercenary' attacks after the fatal exchange of fire with the Florida-registered boat.

title: Pakistan-Afghanistan Clashes LIVE: Inside Taliban's 'Suicide Squad' After Pakistan's 'Open War' Claim
content: Pakistan-Afghanistan Tensions LIVE Updates: Pakistan bombed Afghanistan's cities, including Kabul and Kandahar, after Afghan forces attacked Pakistani border troops.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Hypocrisy Of Pakistan's Growing Frustration With India-Israel Ties
content: Even before the conclusion of PM Modi's visit, editorials and op-eds appeared in the media, indulging in fear-mongering about India and Israel's deepening ties.

title: Bihar Boy Tethered, Lowered Into Well To Rescue Goat Kid
content: A boy was tethered and lowered into a well in Bihar's Motihari as scores of people watched a risky rescue mission to retrieve a goat kid stuck inside unfold.

title: For 1st Time Since 1929, More Americans Left US Than New Residents Moved In
content: For the first time since the Great Depression, more Americans left the country than new residents moved in last year. The US, long known as the land of immigration, is seeing the opposite in its 250th year.

title: Banned NCERT Book Prepared By Panel With Lawyer, No Legal Review Provision
content: The NCERT's Class 8 Social Science textbook, which was withdrawn after a controversy over a reference to corruption in the judiciary, was prepared by a panel of subject experts that included a lawyer, officials said

title: Supreme Court Dismisses SpiceJet Plea, Slaps Rs 1 Lakh Cost On Chairman Ajay Singh
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a petition filed by SpiceJet Limited and its chairman Ajay Singh challenging a Delhi High Court order directing the airline to deposit ₹144.5 crore in a long-running financial dispute with media baron Kalanithi Maran.

title: "Right To Hold Passport Integral To Personal Liberty": Delhi High Court
content: Right to hold a passport and travel abroad is an integral facet of personal liberty under Article 21 of the Constitution of India, the Delhi High Court has said.

title: Video: Air Force Showcases "Longest Ever Kill In Military History" By S-400
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has released a video showing the S400 Sudarshan longrange air defence missile system in action.

title: Video: Union Minister Was Speaking At Kolkata Event, Then Quake Struck
content: Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar was addressing a gathering in Kolkata when an earthquake struck the City of Joy this afternoon

title: Solar Infra Blamed For Madhya Pradesh Tigress's Death. Why It's Alarming
content: Eight tiger deaths were reported in Madhya Pradesh, three by electrocution, including the latest of a tigress allegedly by continuous electric current from solar-powered fencing.

title: "Was Very Scary": Social Media Flooded With Kolkata Earthquake Posts
content: A burst of social media posts originating from the City of Joy flooded the internet as people frantically ran out of their homes, offices and other buildings following a magnitude 4.9 earthquake.

title: Kolkata Earthquake Live Updates: Poll Body Officials Run Out Of Building
content: Kolkata earthquake Live Updates: An earthquake of magnitude 4.9 momentarily shook Kolkata this afternoon. People rushed out of homes, offices, and schools out of panic.

title: Champions League talking points: Madrid, PSG or Italian football -- who is worse off?
content: seventeen goals and three red cards in four games capped chaotic night . a 5-2 aggregate win over internazionale and 5-2 win over england . manchester united and chelsea both made light work of club brugge and FK Qarabag .

title: The game that will define the 2026 season for every power-conference team
content: the season-defining game will be for all 68 power-conference teams in 2026 . peruse BC's schedule given last year's struggles, and it's tough to find many wins . the Eagles open on the road at Cincinnati, then play FCS Maine .

title: NFLPA 2026 report cards: See the results for all 32 teams
content: ESPN obtained the results of the NFL Players Association's 2026 report cards . it grades franchises from A-plus to F-minus on everything from ownership to treatment of families . all players who were on a 2025 roster at the time of the survey were eligible to participate .

title: Way-too-early roster predictions for the 2026 MLB All-Star Game
content: it's time for our annual way-too-early All-Star selections . we predict who will make the trip to Philadelphia for the 2026 Midsummer Classic in 138 days . 34 players have hit at least 50 home runs in a season, with 23 doing it just once .

title: How Keaton Wagler emerged atop a loaded freshman class
content: a hint of exasperation in underwood's voice as he ran through the well-worn tropes about Keaton Wagler . the coach is sensitive to minimizing Wagler's journey, or separating him from the group of freshmen who have taken over the men's college basketball season . underwood: "if the story is that everybody missed on him, we didn't"

title: Prospects to watch: From the high school son of a former MLB All-Star to the next Mets ace﻿
content: the 2026 World Baseball Classic offers a unique opportunity to get a glimpse at some of baseball's stars of tomorrow . one of the most intriguing is Joseph Contreras, a prep right-hander in Georgia and the son of former big league righty . he is best known for his time with the New York Yankees and Chicago White Sox .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Matt Holliday's Stillwater estate listed for $12 million
content: a Stillwater, Oklahoma, home that once belonged to an MLB champion and seven-time All-Star is on the market at $12 million . the home features sports-related amenities such as a professionally lit baseball field in the front yard, a putting green in the backyard, and a $2 million, two-level swimming pool . indoor batting cages, pickleball and basketball courts reside in a detached $150,000 guest home on the property .

title: Gauhati HC issues notice to CM Himanta Biswa Sarma over ‘hate speeches’
content: the high court issued a notice to chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on a PIL seeking directions to restrain the CM from allegedly making hate speeches . the petitioners said such continued inaction creates a chilling effect on victims and witnesses, renders ordinary statutory remedies illusory .

title: Kiper's latest NFL mock draft: Projecting the entire first round ahead of the combine
content: more than 300 prospects will be in Indianapolis this week for the combine . only 32 of them will ultimately go in Round 1 of the 2026 NFL draft on April 23 . there hasn't been a ton of movement on the board yet .
